text:
One evening, a while after finishing the grand adventure to save the "Endangered World",
and witnessing the reunion of Barte and her master...
[Player] was on vacation, visiting the oceanic planet Muira IV.
Aisacks, one of the city ships connected to the largest city fleet, Estevolta.

As its cityscape began to be bathed in the setting sun,
the person [Player] was meeting walked from the
direction of the pier where the transport ships arrived and departed.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Hey, [Player].
Kept you waiting a long time, huh.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...I'm not gonna bother retorting anymore.
It's dreadful and I'm not in the mood.

options.text: No, I just got here, so it's fine.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Don't lie to me.
You do know the only ship from this planet to Earth arrives in the morning, right?

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Sorry, the ferry from the prison ship only sails at this time.
It ended up being pretty late.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Plus, I went to visit the 'land folks' this morning too...
It was an all-day affair.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Ah, well, yeah.
I wasn't really keen on going to the 'land folks',
but I figured it was fine to visit once in a while.

options.text: How were your former pirate buddies?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Well, they were the same as always.
They apparently even check out the swimming competitions I compete in, even from inside the prison.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
They've completely lost their venom and just became good-natured folks.
They cheered me on like crazy.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Well, same as always.
All of them had gloomy faces.
They're truly a bunch of weaklings.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
But they apparently check out the shows I appear in quite a bit.
That was the only thing that surprised me.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
It was pretty out of character for me, but...
sometimes, visiting old acquaintances isn't so bad.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
You don't really think about your roots unless you make an effort to.
It made me feel nostalgic.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
...But I'm not going to the 'land folks' for a while.
They're waiting impatiently for me to bring back a partner.
Geez...

options.text: Don't say that, you should go back to them.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text: Hah! Even if I found someone I could bring back, I'd never let them meet those guys.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text: I can tell exactly what they'll say next. Those country bumpkins.

options.text: How about I become your partner?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Whaâ€”! Hey, you shouldn't say things like that so lightly!
I'll punch you, you bastard!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Besides, I know exactly what those guys expect from a partner!
I'm absolutely not letting them meet anyone!

options.text: I kinda want to meet them.
You could've taken me with you.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Why would you...?
What would you even do by meeting them?
You wouldn't have anything to talk about.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
If you went to meet those guys,
most of what they'd talk about is my past self, you know?
What's so interesting about that?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Really...?
Where's the interesting part in that?

options.text: In fact, I'd really like to hear it.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
You...
You're seriously too fond of weird stuff.

options.text: I want to know more about you, Hydoor.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Hydoor (Summer)
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...How can you say things like that so casually?
It's making me embarrassed.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Anyway, if it's about me, you should just ask me directly.
Is that not enough for you?

options.text: Because you don't talk much about your past.
I couldn't ask much during the journey either.
You didn't even let me ask in the first place.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Ugh...
I just don't like looking back at the past, you know.

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
Even during our journey,
I only looked back because it seemed necessary...

Hydoor sighed, looking away.
After thinking for a moment, he turned to [Player].

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
...[Player].
Can you transform me into that form?

name: Hydoor (Summer)
text:
That form where we cut down that
huge monster by borrowing everyone's strength.

â€”And so, [Player] observed Hydoor's new potential,
which they had witnessed during that journey.

A pair of large cutlasses, a bandana and coat reminiscent of his pirate days,
a suit like swimwear, and armor...

It was truly a form where the past Hydoor
and the present Hydoor were seamlessly fused.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
...Listen.
It's true that the foundation for this Parallel Weapon
is my past self, when I was a pirate.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Without that, I wouldn't have chosen this weapon.
But...

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Those who only know my past self
probably couldn't observe this form.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
This is the form I gained after I, my current self,
traveled with you guys in that world, and fought those monsters.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Of course, even those who know my past wouldn't
know what kind of journey we had in that other world.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
And, as I said earlier...
I don't really look back on the past much,
and I don't tell anyone those stories.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Not even the folks at the agency.
So, the person who knows me best in this world isâ€”

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Without a doubt, it's the comrades from that journey.
Especially you, who observed this form...
you're probably way ahead of the rest.

Hydoor held up one of his cutlasses,
on whose blade light constantly flowed like liquid,
towards the sky.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
...Thinking about it like that, it feels a little embarrassing, but...
If it's you... it's not bad.

options.text: But there are still parts I don't know...

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
...Sigh. Seriously, you bastard.
You want to probe into my life that much?

Saying that, Hydoor sheathed one of his blades, and with that handâ€”
he pulled [Player] firmly towards him.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text: Don't look at my past self, look at my current self.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Look at me now, right in front of you...
It's me, I'm the one who's only looking at you.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
Otherwise...
I'll take everything by force, you hear me?
A dragon's breath caressed their skin, and a dragon's sharp gaze pierced [Player].

Now, they were close enough to see each individual scale on his skin...
[Player] was that close to Hydoor.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text: -Haaa. What am I even saying? It's so embarrassing...

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text: Even if I said something like this, it's probably useless against you, anyway...

Saying that, Hydoor released [Player] and began to walk away,
turning his back towards them.

Then, with the connecting bridge leading to the pier behind him,
he extended his hand towards [Player].

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
...Come with me.
Let's go on a date, [Player].

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
If you want to know about me that much, I'll tell you everything...
in the time we have from now on.

name: Hydoor (Traveler)
text:
And while we're at it,
you'll also learn that you're the most important person to me.
...You'd better be prepared.
Hydoor's smile was unusually serious, yet still a little embarrassed.

[Player] took his outstretched hand and
began to walk towards the sunset sea.

â€”That day, indeed.
[Player] and Hydoor grew even closer.
